member.summary: Reverts the batch to an unsaved, version 0 (see remarks) state.
member.remarks: Version 0: When using the Revert method, the batch is set to an unsaved state, allowing it to be saved as another batch. It does not; however, revert back to the last saved state, but rather assumes the current state as far as batch detail is concerned.

member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction's supplier account (maps directly to Account).

member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the Account to which the transaction gets posted.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.TransactionCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the record associated with this transaction, as maintained in Accounts Payable > Maintenance > Transaction Types. Transaction codes/types govern General Ledger integration. This is a mandatory field.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.TransactionCodeID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the record associated with this transaction, which governs General Ledger integration.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.OrderNo
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction order number.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.ExtOrderNo
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction's external order number.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.Project
member.summary: Gets or sets the record associated with this transaction. When using Project Tracking, this field must be specified whereverapplicable.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.ProjectID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the record associated with this transaction. When using Project Tracking, this field must be specified wherever applicable.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction description that - togeter with the - appears on the account's statement by default. This is a mandatory field.
member.remarks: The is usually a sequencial code whereas the description is more general, e.g. a transaction might have the reference "PMB128901" and the description "Payment - Thank You".

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.Outstanding
member.summary: Gets the transaction's outstanding amount.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.ForeignOutstanding
member.summary: Gets the transaction's foreign outstanding amount.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.Reference
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction reference that - together with the - appears on the customer statement by default. This is a mandatory field.
member.remarks: The is usually quite "cryptic" (numbered sequenceetc.) whereas the description is more friendly, e.g. a transaction might have thereference "PMB128901" and the description "Payment - Thank You".

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.Reference2
member.summary: Gets or sets an additional transaction reference.

member.summary: Gets the transaction's foreign debit value, which is determined by the and properties.

member.summary: Gets the transaction's credit value, the value of which is determined by the and properties.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.ForeignCredit
member.summary: Gets the transaction's foreign credit value, which is determined by the and properties.

member.summary: Gets or sets the record associated with this transaction. If a tax type is specified, a tax amount is automatically calculated, but can be overridden.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.Tax
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction tax amount (automatically rounded to 2 decimals).

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.ForeignTax
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction foreign tax amount (automatically rounded to 2 decimals). Note that setting this will switch the entry mode to foreign and recalculate the Amount property.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.Audit
member.summary: Gets the transaction's audit number.
member.remarks: The audit number is 0 when unposted. After posting, it will reflect the transaction's posted audit number.

member.summary: Gets the internal record ID (0 for new, unsaved records).

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.ModID
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction's evolution module id.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.Currency
member.summary: Gets the foreign currency in use on this transaction, determined by the specified account. A null value indicates local currency.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.Amount
member.summary: Gets or sets the (gross) transaction value. Negative values are allowed and will result in inverted debits and credits.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.ForeignAmount
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreign transaction value.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.SplitAllocations

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.Allocations
member.summary: Gets the transaction's allocation collection.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.SplitTaxAllocations
member.summary: Gets the transaction's split tax allocation collection, used to split the tax account posting to various GL accounts.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.OverrideCreditAccount
member.summary: Gets or sets the GL account to use when posting the transaction's credit leg, overriding the credit account configured in the transaction type. When posting a debit transaction, the credit account will actually be debited; I.e. this represents the creditors control account.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.SupplierTransaction.OverrideDebitAccount
member.summary: Gets or sets the GL account to use when posting the transaction's debit leg, overriding the debit account configured in the transaction type. When posting a debit transaction, the debit account will actually be credited.

member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction's customer account (maps directly to Account).

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.AccountID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the Account to which the transaction gets posted.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets the date on which the transaction takes place. This often differs from the actual posting date but defaults to the current date.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.TransactionCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the record associated with this transaction, as maintained in Accounts Receivable > Maintenance > Transaction Types. Transaction codes/types govern General Ledger integration. This is a mandatory field.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.TransactionCodeID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the record associated with this transaction, which governs General Ledger integration.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.OrderNo
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction order number.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.ExtOrderNo
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction's external order number.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.Project
member.summary: Gets or sets the record associated with this transaction. When using Project Tracking, this field must be specified wherever applicable.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.ProjectID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the record associated with this transaction. When using Project Tracking, this field must be specified wherever applicable.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction description that - togeter with the - appears on the account's statement by default. This is a mandatory field.
member.remarks: The is usually a sequencial code whereas the description is more general, e.g. a transaction might have the reference "PMB128901" and the description "Payment - Thank You".

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.Outstanding
member.summary: Gets the transaction's outstanding amount.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.ForeignOutstanding
member.summary: Gets the transaction's foreign outstanding amount.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.Reference
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction reference that - together with the - appears on the customer statement by default. This is a mandatory field.
member.remarks: The is usually quite "cryptic" (numbered sequenceetc.) whereas the description is more friendly, e.g. a transaction might have thereference "PMB128901" and the description "Payment - Thank You".

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.Reference2
member.summary: Gets or sets an additional transaction reference.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.Debit
member.summary: Gets the transaction's debit value, the value of which is determined by the and properties.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.ForeignDebit
member.summary: Gets the transaction's foreign debit value, which is determined by the and properties.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.Credit
member.summary: Gets the transaction's credit value, the value of which is determined by the and properties.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.ForeignCredit
member.summary: Gets the transaction's foreign credit value, which is determined by the and properties.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.TaxRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the record associated with this transaction. If a tax type is specified, a tax amount is automatically calculated, but can be overridden.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.TaxRateID
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction's tax type id.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.Tax
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction tax amount (automatically rounded to 2 decimals).

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.ForeignTax
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction foreign tax amount (automatically rounded to 2 decimals). Note that setting this will switch the entry mode to foreign and recalculate the Amount property.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.Audit
member.summary: Gets the transaction's audit number.
member.remarks: The audit number is 0 when unposted. After posting, it will reflect the transaction's posted audit number.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.ID
member.summary: Gets the internal record ID (0 for new, unsaved records).

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.ModID
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction's evolution module id.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.Currency
member.summary: Gets the foreign currency in use on this transaction, determined by the specified account. A null value indicates local currency.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.PostDated
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the transaction is a Post Dated Transaction.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.TransactionType
member.summary: Gets or sets the transaction type.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.Amount
member.summary: Gets or sets the (gross) transaction value. Negative values are allowed and will result in inverted debits and credits.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.ForeignAmount
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreign transaction value.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.SplitAllocations
member.summary: Gets the transaction's split allocation collection, used to split the contra account posting to various GL accounts.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.Allocations
member.summary: Gets the transaction's allocation collection.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.SplitTaxAllocations
member.summary: Gets the transaction's split tax allocation collection, used to split the tax account posting to various GL accounts.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.SalesRep
member.summary: Gets or sets the Sales Rep.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.OverrideDebitAccount
member.summary: Gets or sets the GL account to use when posting the transaction's debit leg, overriding the debit account configured in the transaction type. When posting a credit transaction, the debit account will actually be credited; I.e. this represents the debtors control account.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CustomerTransaction.OverrideCreditAccount
member.summary: Gets or sets the GL account to use when posting the transaction's credit leg, overriding the credit account configured in the transaction type. When posting a credit transaction, the credit account will actually be debited.

member.returns: A System.Data.DataTable object containing matching records.

member.name: M:Pastel.Evolution.DatabaseContext.RequireTransaction(System.String)
member.summary: Asserts that a transaction is in progress.

member.name: M:Pastel.Evolution.DatabaseContext.BeginTran
member.summary: Starts a global database transaction.
member.remarks: Certain operations will implicitly begin and end a transaction if a transaction is not already pending. If deciding to manage the transaction yourself, be sure to include this in a try-catch block calling RollbackTran or CommitTran methods accordingly. Also be aware that most client tools have their transaction isolation level set to "read commited" by default, so while this transaction is in progress, other data requests for data will be delayed.
member.returns: True if a transaction was actually started; false if a transaction was already pending.

member.name: M:Pastel.Evolution.DatabaseContext.CommitTran
member.summary: Quietly commits the global transaction regardless of whether it is actually pending.
member.returns: True if a transaction was actually pending; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Pastel.Evolution.DatabaseContext.RollbackTran
member.summary: Quietly aborts the global transaction regardless of whether it is actually open.
member.returns: True if a transaction was actually pending; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Pastel.Evolution.DatabaseContext.IncrementAuditNumber
member.summary: Increment the current audit trail number.
member.returns: True if an audit number succesfully incremented; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Pastel.Evolution.DatabaseContext.ExecuteCommandScalar(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand)
member.summary: Executes a command and returns the 1st value from 1st value. Will convert a return value of DBNull to null.

member.name: M:Pastel.Evolution.DatabaseContext.ExecuteCommandScalar(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand)
member.summary: Executes the query, and returns the first column of the first row in the result set returned by the query. Additional columns or rows are ignored.
member.returns: The first column of the first row in the result set, or a null reference if the result set is empty. This function will return a null reference instead of a DBNull value.

member.name: T:Pastel.Evolution.Internal.EvolutionEncryption
member.summary: Class EvolutionEncryption is a utility to encrypt a string and return a string that only contains normal text characters (so will not contain #0 for e.g.) so that it can safely be stored in areas that cannot handle special characters.
member.remarks: The string returned could possibly be longer than the input string by a factor probably not exceeding 1.5:1, so make sure that the storage space is larger than the maximum expected input string.

member.name: M:Pastel.Evolution.Internal.EvolutionEncryption.Encrypt(System.String)
member.summary: Encrypt a string using the default keys.
member.param: A plain text string to encrypt.

member.name: M:Pastel.Evolution.Internal.EvolutionEncryption.Decrypt(System.String)
member.summary: Decrypt a string using the default keys.
member.param: An encrypted string to decrypt.

member.name: M:Pastel.Evolution.Internal.EvolutionEncryption.ValidatePassword(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validate a plain text password (probably entered by the user) against an encrypted password (probably from the database) by encrypting the plain text password and comparing it to the encrypted password to avoid the security risk of decrypting the encrypted password in memory.
member.param: The plain text password.
The encryped password string.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.CashbookBatchDetail.Debit
member.summary: Sets the transaction debit amount.
member.remarks: Be careful when setting both debit and credit values. When setting debit to a negative value, debit will immediately become 0 and credit will immediately be set to the reverse of the value. If then setting credit to 0, the transaction amount will be cancelled.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.InventoryItem.IsWarehouseTracked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the item is tracked in warehouses.
member.remarks: If set true, and no warehouses are explicitly added to the WarehouseContexts collection, the item will get linked to the default warehouses.
member.exception: An existing item's warehouse status may not be altered.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.InventoryItem.IsServiceItem
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the item is a service item.
member.remarks: Service items are sold or purchased without regard for a quantity on hand.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.InventoryItem.IsSerialTracked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the stock item is tracked by serial numbers.
member.remarks: When set true, IsStrictSerialTracked also defaults to true.
member.exception: An existing item's serial tracking status may not be altered.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.InventoryItem.AllowDuplicateSerialNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the serial number item allows for duplicate serial numbers.
member.remarks: Item needs to be set as a non-strict serial number item to allow for duplicate serial numbers.
member.exception: An existing item's serial tracking status may not be altered.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.InventoryItem.IsLotTracked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the stock item is tracked in lots.
member.exception: An existing item's lot tracking status may not be altered.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.InventoryItem._LotsExpire
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the stock item is tracked in lots.
member.exception: An existing item's lot tracking status may not be altered.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.InventoryItem.IsStrictSerialTracked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the stock item is serial-tracked using the "strict" method.
member.remarks: Strict serial number tracking means that for every unit moved, a serial number must be supplied.
member.exception: An existing item's serial tracking configuration may not be altered.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.InventoryItem.IsCommissionable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the stock item is commissionable.
member.remarks: Commissionable items contribute sales & profit values to the sales representative report.

member.summary: Whether or not the item is made up of segments.

member.name: M:Pastel.Evolution.OrderBase.Complete
member.summary: Processes (invoices) all outstanding quantities on the order. The entire invoice fails if one or more detail lines do not have sufficient stock available. The CompleteMax method (SalesOrder only) is a variation on this method and attempts to confirm as much of the ordered stock as is available.

member.name: M:Pastel.Evolution.OrderBase.Complete(System.String)
member.summary: Process (invoice) all outstanding quantities on the order. The entire invoice fails if one or more detail lines do not have sufficient stock available. The method is a variation on this method and attempts to confirm as much of the ordered stock as is available.
member.param: Specifies the transaction reference to use. No duplication checking is performed

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailSalesDocketBase.Representative
member.summary: Gets or sets the retail document sales representative.
member.remarks: Be sure to set the document representative before adding detail records. This will ensure the sales rep is set on the detail records. Alternatively, the sales rep can be specified for each detail record, or even overridden after adding the detail record to the document. Warning: when "Post sales rep per line" inventory option is disabled, the representative on all detail records will be replaced when setting the document representative.

member.summary: Gets the line's original detail record.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.Account
member.summary: Gets or sets the line's account (inventory item).
member.remarks: When setting the item, the unit cost price is also set.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.InventoryItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the line's inventory item.
member.remarks: Setting this value will in effect set the Account. When setting the item, the unit cost price is also set.

members.member: Gets or sets the stock item id. Note that there is no performace benefit in setting the InventoryItemID rather than the InventoryItem since setting the item ID actually instantiates an InventoryItem object for validation.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the line description.
member.remarks: If the description field is blank on assignment of the property, it will default to the inventory item description.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.SerialNumbers
member.summary: Gets the collection of serial numbers pertaining to the order detail record.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.Quantity
member.summary: Gets or sets the quantity of product on order.
member.remarks: In an order scenario, this is the quantity of product expected to be moved. This quantity gets rounded according to the rounding configuration set in inventory defaults.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.Outstanding
member.summary: Gets the quantity of stock that remains to be processed.
member.remarks: The calculation is Quantity - Processed.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.Processed
member.summary: Gets the quantity of stock processed on this line up until this document.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.Reserved
member.summary: Gets or sets the quantity of stock to reserve for an order (only applies to sales orders).
member.remarks: Reserving stock ensures that items are not shipped on other orders. Only stock on hand can be reserved, i.e. stock that is on purchase order cannot be reserved in advance.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.ToProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets the quantity of stock to move when calling the Process method.
member.remarks: This cannot exceed the outstanding quantity.
This value also has to effect on credit notes and returns to suppliers.
member.exception: The quantity ToProcess exceeds the Quantity property value. Increase the order quantity first.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.LastProcess
member.summary: Gets the stock quantity moved during the last processing action.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.Note
member.summary: Gets or sets the line note text.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.PriceListNameID
member.summary: Gets or sets the line pricelistID.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.TaxMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the line's tax mode.
member.remarks: When attaching a detail record to an order with a differrent tax mode, the line's tax mode will automatically switch and the price be recalculated. New detail records default to tax exclusive mode and not to the mode set in inventory defaults. This was done for backward compatibility with earlier implementations of the SDK. Use the appropriate constructor for specifying the tax mode.
member.exception: The tax mode of a record linked to an order cannot be changed.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.UnitSellingPrice
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit selling or purchase price.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.UnitSellingPriceForeign
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreign unit selling price - on sales orders this will be the product selling price as expected, but on purchase orders, it is the supplier's selling price.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.UnitSellingPriceAfterDiscount
member.summary: Gets the line's unit selling price after discount.
member.remarks: Unlike UnitSellingPriceExclAfterDiscount, this value is based on the tax mode.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.UnitSellingPriceExclAfterLineDiscount
member.summary: Gets the order detail's unit selling price excl after line discount (unrounded).

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.UnitSellingPriceAfterDocumentDiscountExcl
member.summary: Gets the order detail's unit selling price excl after line and document discount (unrounded).

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.DiscountPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the line discount percentage as an integer value: 5% = 5, as opposed to 0.05

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.Index
member.summary: Gets the line number (1-based)

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.Discount
member.summary: Gets or sets the total line discount value (applies to tax excl. value)

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.DiscountForeign
member.summary: Gets the total foreign line discount value (applies to tax excl. value)

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.WarehouseContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the warehouse context of the inventory item specified. Set the warehouse only after setting the inventory item. The Warehouse and WarehouseContext properties are mapped to one another.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.Warehouse
member.summary: Gets or sets the warehouse relevant to this detail record. Set the warehouse only after setting the inventory item. The Warehouse and WarehouseContext properties are mapped to one another.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.WarehouseID
member.summary: Gets the ID of the assigned warehouse (0 if N/A).

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.LineDocketMode
member.summary: Gets the retail line docket mode

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.TotalExcl
member.summary: Gets the calculated, rounded line total exclusive amount, after discount.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.TotalTax
member.summary: Gets or sets the line total tax amount. Set this value as late as possible as it gets recalculated on setting Quantity, UnitSellingPrice, DiscountPercent, Discount, TaxType, as well as when adding the order detail record to the orders's Detail collection. IMPORTANT: Be sure to only use the Process() method and not one of the Complete* methods if you wish to override the tax amount. Setting TotalTax also does not affect TotalToProcessTax.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.TotalTaxBeforeDiscount
member.summary: Gets the tax amount before discount was applied. If discount is 100% and the total tax amount is 0, the tax rate is used to calculate a default tax amount.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.TotalIncl
member.summary: Gets the calculated line total inclusive amount, after discount.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.TotalToProcessTax
member.summary: Gets or sets the line total tax amount for the following invoice. Set this value as late as possible as it gets recalculated on setting ToProcess, UnitSellingPrice, DiscountPercent, Discount, TaxType, as well as when adding the order detail record to the orders's Detail collection. IMPORTANT: Be sure to only use the Process() method and not one of the Complete* methods only if you wish to override the tax amount.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.UnitCostPrice
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit cost price (used by credit notes only).
member.remarks: The unit cost price defaults to the current item cost price in the system but can be overridden if required. Override only after setting the inventory item and warehouse.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.TotalAdditionalCost
member.summary: Gets or sets the additional cost allocated to the line.
member.remarks: When processing, the total costs allocated to lines needs to match the document additional cost allocation.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.TotalSalesCost
member.summary: Gets the line total cost of sale; i.e. current unit cost * quantity

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.JobID
member.summary: Gets or sets the order detail record's job id.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.OverrideSalesAccount
member.summary: Specifies the GL account to use when processing the document's sales transaction.
member.remarks: The sales account only applies to sales transactions (Sales order invoices and credit notes) and overrides the contra account on theinvoice and credit note transaction types. The GL account specified here also overrides the account defined on the item group or warehouse-specific group. Note that this value does not get saved with unprocessed documents. When set to null (as is the case when assigning a non-existing account via the GL Account's Get* methods), the default account will still be used.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.OverrideCostOfSalesAccount
member.summary: Specifies the GL account to use when processing the document's cost of goods sold transaction.
member.remarks: The cost of sales account only applies to sales transactions (Sales order invoices and credit notes) and overrides "account 1" on the"issue stock" and "receive stock" transaction types. The GL account specified here also overrides the COS account defined on the item group or warehouse-specific group. No COS transaction is posted when using the period GL integration method as set in Inventory Defaults. Note that this value does not get saved with unprocessed documents. When set to null (as is the case when assigning a non-existing account via the GL Account's Get* methods), the default account will still be used.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.OverrideStockAccount
member.summary: Specifies the GL account to use when processing the document's GL stock transaction.
member.remarks: The stock account only applies to sales transactions (Sales order invoices and credit notes) and overrides "account 2" on the"issue stock" and "receive stock" transaction types. The GL account specified here also overrides the stock account defined on the item group or warehouse-specific group. No stock transaction is posted when using the periodic GL integration method as set in Inventory Defaults. Note that this value does not get saved with unprocessed documents. When set to null (as is the case when assigning a non-existing account via the GL Account's Get* methods), the default account will still be used. If this property is not set and during posting the stock account is overridden, it will reflect the overriding account after posting.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.RetailDocketDetail.OverridePurchaseAccount
member.summary: Specifies the purchases GL account to use when processing the document's GL transactions. Currently this is merely an alias for
member.remarks: The purchases account only applies to purchases transactions (Purchase order invoices and returns) and overrides the contra account set on the"supplier invoice" and "return to supplier" transaction types. The GL account specified here also overrides the purchaes account defined on the item group or warehouse-specific group. Note that this value does not get saved with unprocessed documents. When set to null (as is the case when assigning a non-existing account via the GL Account's Get* methods), the default account will still be used.

member.summary: Gets or sets the document sales representative.
member.remarks: Be sure to set the document representative before adding detail records. This will ensure the sales rep is set on the detail records. Alternatively, the sales rep can be specified for each detail record, or even overridden after adding the detail record to the document. Warning: when "Post sales rep per line" inventory option is disabled, the representative on all detail records will be replaced when setting the document representative.

member.name: T:Pastel.Evolution.AgeingDate
member.summary: Specifies the date to use when ageing transactions on an ageing reports.

remarks.example: E.g. when a transaction is dated 31 January 2000, and a statement is generated for 31 March 2000, it will be aged under 30 Days if the invoice date is used, but 60 Days if statement date (month-end) is used.

member.name: T:Pastel.Evolution.GLBatch
member.summary: Facilitates batch processing of GL transactions. Mainly used internally and not to be confused with journal batches.

member.name: M:Pastel.Evolution.GLBatch.Add(Pastel.Evolution.GLTransaction)
member.summary: Adds a GL transaction to the batch without attempting consolidation.

member.name: M:Pastel.Evolution.GLBatch.Add(Pastel.Evolution.GLTransaction,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a GL transaction to the batch, optionally consolidating.
member.remarks: This overloaded method provides the ability to consolidate the transaction with another transaction in the batch, matching on account, module id, tax type, date, and transaction code. If the strict option is used,reference, and description are matched as well. Note: debits and credits are always consolidated separately.
member.param: Specifies the transaction.
Specifies whether or not to consolidate.
Specifies whether or not to consolidate according to stricter criteria, i.e. reference and description values also have to match.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.Account
member.summary: Gets or sets the line's account (inventory item or GL account [in near future]).
member.remarks: When setting the item, the unit cost price is also set.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.InventoryItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the line's inventory item.
member.remarks: Setting this value will in effect set the Account. When setting the item, the unit cost price is also set.

members.member: Gets or sets the stock item id. Note that there is no performace benefit in setting the InventoryItemID rather than the InventoryItem since setting the item ID actually instantiates an InventoryItem object for validation.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.GLAccount
member.summary: Gets or sets the line's GLAccount.
member.remarks: Setting this value will in effect set the Account.

members.member: Gets or sets the GLAccount item id. Note that there is no performace benefit in setting the GLAccountID rather than the GLAccount since setting the item ID actually instantiates an GLAccount object for validation.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the line description.
member.remarks: If the description field is blank on assignment of the property, it will default to the inventory item description.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.SerialNumbers
member.summary: Gets the collection of serial numbers pertaining to the order detail record.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.Quantity
member.summary: Gets or sets the quantity of product on order.
member.remarks: In an order scenario, this is the quantity of product expected to be moved. This quantity gets rounded according to the rounding configuration set in inventory defaults.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.Outstanding
member.summary: Gets the quantity of stock that remains to be processed.
member.remarks: The calculation is Quantity - Processed.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.Processed
member.summary: Gets the quantity of stock processed on this line up until this document.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.Reserved
member.summary: Gets or sets the quantity of stock to reserve for an order (only applies to sales orders).
member.remarks: Reserving stock ensures that items are not shipped on other orders. Only stock on hand can be reserved, i.e. stock that is on purchase order cannot be reserved in advance.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.ToProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets the quantity of stock to move when calling the Process method.
member.remarks: This cannot exceed the outstanding quantity.
This value also has to effect on credit notes and returns to suppliers.
member.exception: The quantity ToProcess exceeds the Quantity property value. Increase the order quantity first.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.LastProcess
member.summary: Gets the stock quantity moved during the last processing action.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.Note
member.summary: Gets or sets the line note text.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.PriceListNameID
member.summary: Gets or sets the line pricelistID.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.TaxMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the line's tax mode.
member.remarks: When attaching a detail record to an order with a differrent tax mode, the line's tax mode will automatically switch and the price be recalculated. New detail records default to tax exclusive mode and not to the mode set in inventory defaults. This was done for backward compatibility with earlier implementations of the SDK. Use the appropriate constructor for specifying the tax mode.
member.exception: The tax mode of a record linked to an order cannot be changed.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.UnitSellingPrice
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit selling or purchase price.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.UnitSellingPriceForeign
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreign unit selling price - on sales orders this will be the product selling price as expected, but on purchase orders, it is the supplier's selling price.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.UnitSellingPriceAfterDiscount
member.summary: Gets the line's unit selling price after discount.
member.remarks: Unlike UnitSellingPriceExclAfterDiscount, this value is based on the tax mode.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.UnitSellingPriceExclAfterLineDiscount
member.summary: Gets the order detail's unit selling price excl after line discount (unrounded).

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.UnitSellingPriceAfterDocumentDiscountExcl
member.summary: Gets the order detail's unit selling price excl after line and document discount (unrounded).

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.DiscountPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the line discount percentage as an integer value: 5% = 5, as opposed to 0.05

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.Index
member.summary: Gets the line number (1-based)

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.Discount
member.summary: Gets or sets the total line discount value (applies to tax excl. value)

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.DiscountForeign
member.summary: Gets the total foreign line discount value (applies to tax excl. value)

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.WarehouseContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the warehouse context of the inventory item specified. Set the warehouse only after setting the inventory item. The Warehouse and WarehouseContext properties are mapped to one another.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.Warehouse
member.summary: Gets or sets the warehouse relevant to this detail record. Set the warehouse only after setting the inventory item. The Warehouse and WarehouseContext properties are mapped to one another.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.WarehouseID
member.summary: Gets the ID of the assigned warehouse (0 if N/A).

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.TotalExcl
member.summary: Gets the calculated, rounded line total exclusive amount, after discount.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.TotalTax
member.summary: Gets or sets the line total tax amount. Set this value as late as possible as it gets recalculated on setting Quantity, UnitSellingPrice, DiscountPercent, Discount, TaxType, as well as when adding the order detail record to the orders's Detail collection. IMPORTANT: Be sure to only use the Process() method and not one of the Complete* methods if you wish to override the tax amount. Setting TotalTax also does not affect TotalToProcessTax.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.TotalTaxBeforeDiscount
member.summary: Gets the tax amount before discount was applied. If discount is 100% and the total tax amount is 0, the tax rate is used to calculate a default tax amount.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.TotalIncl
member.summary: Gets the calculated line total inclusive amount, after discount.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.TotalToProcessTax
member.summary: Gets or sets the line total tax amount for the following invoice. Set this value as late as possible as it gets recalculated on setting ToProcess, UnitSellingPrice, DiscountPercent, Discount, TaxType, as well as when adding the order detail record to the orders's Detail collection. IMPORTANT: Be sure to only use the Process() method and not one of the Complete* methods only if you wish to override the tax amount.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.UnitCostPrice
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit cost price (used by credit notes only).
member.remarks: The unit cost price defaults to the current item cost price in the system but can be overridden if required. Override only after setting the inventory item and warehouse.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.TotalAdditionalCost
member.summary: Gets or sets the additional cost allocated to the line.
member.remarks: When processing, the total costs allocated to lines needs to match the document additional cost allocation.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.TotalAdditionalCostForeign
member.summary: Gets or sets the additional cost allocated to the line.
member.remarks: When processing, the total costs allocated to lines needs to match the document additional cost allocation.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.TotalSalesCost
member.summary: Gets the line total cost of sale; i.e. current unit cost * quantity

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.JobID
member.summary: Gets or sets the order detail record's job id.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.OverrideSalesAccount
member.summary: Specifies the GL account to use when processing the document's sales transaction.
member.remarks: The sales account only applies to sales transactions (Sales order invoices and credit notes) and overrides the contra account on theinvoice and credit note transaction types. The GL account specified here also overrides the account defined on the item group or warehouse-specific group. Note that this value does not get saved with unprocessed documents. When set to null (as is the case when assigning a non-existing account via the GL Account's Get* methods), the default account will still be used.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.OverrideCostOfSalesAccount
member.summary: Specifies the GL account to use when processing the document's cost of goods sold transaction.
member.remarks: The cost of sales account only applies to sales transactions (Sales order invoices and credit notes) and overrides "account 1" on the"issue stock" and "receive stock" transaction types. The GL account specified here also overrides the COS account defined on the item group or warehouse-specific group. No COS transaction is posted when using the period GL integration method as set in Inventory Defaults. Note that this value does not get saved with unprocessed documents. When set to null (as is the case when assigning a non-existing account via the GL Account's Get* methods), the default account will still be used.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.OverrideStockAccount
member.summary: Specifies the GL account to use when processing the document's GL stock transaction.
member.remarks: The stock account only applies to sales transactions (Sales order invoices and credit notes) and overrides "account 2" on the"issue stock" and "receive stock" transaction types. The GL account specified here also overrides the stock account defined on the item group or warehouse-specific group. No stock transaction is posted when using the periodic GL integration method as set in Inventory Defaults. Note that this value does not get saved with unprocessed documents. When set to null (as is the case when assigning a non-existing account via the GL Account's Get* methods), the default account will still be used. If this property is not set and during posting the stock account is overridden, it will reflect the overriding account after posting.

member.name: P:Pastel.Evolution.OrderDetail.OverridePurchaseAccount
member.summary: Specifies the purchases GL account to use when processing the document's GL transactions. Currently this is merely an alias for
member.remarks: The purchases account only applies to purchases transactions (Purchase order invoices and returns) and overrides the contra account set on the"supplier invoice" and "return to supplier" transaction types. The GL account specified here also overrides the purchaes account defined on the item group or warehouse-specific group. Note that this value does not get saved with unprocessed documents. When set to null (as is the case when assigning a non-existing account via the GL Account's Get* methods), the default account will still be used.
